description:
Only shows the droplet icon on Gnome Shell, with no apparent way to bring up the main window.

Also: the translation breaks it, because the program relies on some of the strings to be in english for some of the operations to work. So it's pretty much unusable for non-english users.

I use this program frequently at work to make my progress screenshots email friendly or PDF ready. I find the UI a tad cumbersome, or I'd have given it 5 stars. Point is, if you have 200 images and you need to resize and change the format of all of them, this is a gigantic time saver.
It is in my opinion the best tool out ther for batch managing images in Linux. Keep up the good work!
EL plugin que necesitaba (marca de agua, nunca cargó mi logo, simplemente no funciona.  A darle con gimp y listo, esa aplicación si que funciona.
The logo gets out, and that's all (Fedora 27 workstation).
L'application ne ressemble pas à la photo. Un bouton avec une roue dentée et c'est tout ... Rien ne marche
